metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0829 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in libstagefright in Mozilla Firefox before 36.0 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted MP4 video that is improperly handled during playback.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0829` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-globalmenu - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-mozsymbols - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
firefox-testsuite - 36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '36.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
